content: grab and go bag materials *60 grams of worsted weight yarn if you prefer use 20 grams of fingering weight yarn self striping sock yarn works great your bag will be smaller but it s perfect to hold a cake of fingering yarn *size 6/4 0 mm needles use dpns flexi flips long circular for magic loop 9 or 10 inch circular 2 circulars - or whatever you usually use for knitting in the round for fingering yarn use size 2/2 75mm needles *you will need 2 dpns for i-cord use the same size you used for knitting the body of the bag *beginning of row marker removable stitch marker *waste yarn or 4 safety pins at least 1 1/2 *tapestry needle *4 paper tags labeled 1 2 3 and 4 cast on 6 stitches you may cast on any way you choose i have found that the pin hole cast on is my favorite way to do this there are several u-tube videos to help you through this after your 6 stitches are cast on you will be joining to knit in the round the first round or 2 are awkward and it may help to start with your needles lying flat on a table once you get beyond the first few row it s easier to manage at any point where you feel that it s needed add a beginning of row marker bor round 1 kfb around - 12 stitches round 2 kfb knit 1 around - 18 stitches round 3 kfb knit 2 around - 24stitches round 4 kfb knit 3 around - 30 stitches round 5 kfb knit 4 around - 36 stitches round 6 kfb knit 5 around - 42 stitches round 7 kfb knit 6 around - 48 stitches round 8 kfb knit 7 around - 54 stitches round 9 kfb knit 8 around - 60 stitches round 10 kfb knit 9 around - 66stitches round 11 knit all stitches around round 12 purl all stitches around continue to knit in stockinette stitch knit all stitches until you have knit between 4 1/2 to 5 inches from purl row for fingering weight yarn knit until you have between 3 1/2 to 4 inches if you would like to include the stranded take a hike then knit 10 row in the background color and knit from the chart starting at the lower right hand corner after the chart is finished use your background color to knit to the total height then round 1 purl round 2 knit round 3 purl round 4 knit round 5 purl round 6 knit set up for handles knit 11 stitches put those stitches on a safety pin or waste yarn add a tag and label it 1 knit 12 stitches put those stitches on a safety pin or waste yarn add a tag and label it 2 knit 1 stitch and use it to start the bind off the next 9 stitches you will end with 1 stitch
